title: CSS Selectors
desc: Selectors are used to target the HTML elements you want to style, There are multiple ways to select an element.

selectors.title: Universal Selector *
selectors.desc: This selector targets all elements on the page.

selectors.title: Type Selector
selectors.desc: Targets all elements of a given type.

selectors.title: ID Selector #
selectors.desc: Targets an element with a specific ID. IDs are unique, so this selector applies styles to a single element.

selectors.title: Class Selector .
selectors.desc: Targets elements with a specific class attribute. You can give the same class name to multiple elements to style them as a group.

selectors.title: Attribute Selector
selectors.desc: Targets elements based on their attributes.

selectors.title: Descendant Selector
selectors.desc: Selects elements that are descendants or children of another element.

selectors.title: Child Selector >
selectors.desc: Selects elements that are direct children of a specified element.

selectors.title: Adjacent Sibling Selector +
selectors.desc: Targets an element that immediately follows another specified element.

selectors.title: General Sibling Selector ~
selectors.desc: Targets all elements that are siblings of a specified element.

selectors.title: Pseudo-class :hover
selectors.desc: Applies styles when the user hovers over an element.

selectors.title: Pseudo-class :first-child
selectors.desc: Targets the first child element of its parent.

selectors.title: Pseudo-element ::before
selectors.desc: Adds content before an element's content.

selectors.title: Pseudo-element ::after
selectors.desc: Adds content after an element's content.
